description.narrative: Output 7.2: By 2018, communities and families are engaged in the promotion of key family practices (KFP) to improve maternal, newborn and child care and prevent malnutrition and diseases including in emergency situations, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Hygiene, Immunization, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Nutrition â€“ General, Polio Eradication, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Sanitation, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 7: By 2018, leaders, communities, families and young people adopt norms and attitudes more favorable to the survival, development, protection and participation of children, including in emergency situations.

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Children, adolescent and youth engagement and participation
Strengthening C4D in Government systems including preparedness for humanitarian action

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 7.2: By 2018, communities and families are engaged in the promotion of key family practices (KFP) to improve maternal, newborn and child care and prevent malnutrition and diseases including in emergency situations

description.narrative: Knowledge of 2,127,522 persons (848,695 women) improved on mother cares, new born, child health mostly through public, private and community radios and TV. Parent's awareness on vaccination increased from 83.1% in 2017 to 89% in 2018 (standard is 90%). | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019

title.narrative: % of pregnant women that slept under an treated mosquitos nets in convergence municipalities
% of children under 6 months of age exclusively breastfed in convergence municipalities
% of mothers practicing handwashing with soap at 4/5 critical moments in the convergence municipalities
% of children aged 0-59 months that slept under an treated mosquitos nets in convergence municipalities
% of parents informed of the polio vaccination campaign prior to launch
Government-led functional coordination mechanism supporting C4D (Normative, Social and Behavioral) strategies and results in priority areas of the country program
Communication and community engagement platforms/ mechanisms supported by UNICEF meet quality standards across development priorities
